name: Bell Curve
title: DeepSeekâ€™s Impact, the JellyJelly Launch, and Crypto Payments | Roundup
text:
Synopsis
The emergence of DeepSeek, a low-cost AI model from China, signals a potential paradigm shift in AI development, challenging existing assumptions about computational resources and potentially accelerating the convergence of AI and crypto technologies.

Key Insights
- DeepSeek trained an AI model for approximately $5-6 million, potentially competitive with OpenAI's ChatGPT-4
- The model challenges existing expectations about massive infrastructure and capital investments in AI development
- Marc Andreessen characterized this as an "AI Sputnik moment", suggesting a potential technological race
- The low-cost model could democratize AI development, making it more accessible to startups and smaller organizations
- Potential implications include reduced barriers to entry in AI and increased opportunities for crypto-AI integration
- Jerome Powell indicated increased openness to banks supporting crypto services, suggesting potential regulatory warming
- Major financial institutions are preparing to explore crypto-related services, including crypto-backed loans and payments
- Venture capital in crypto is experiencing significant dispersion, with performance increasingly concentrated among top-tier funds
- Decentralized exchanges (DEXs) are growing in market share, now representing approximately 20-21% of spot trading volume
- Meme coins and token launches continue to demonstrate significant market interest, with rapid valuation growth
